oracle.pg.text.lucene

Class LuceneEdgeAutoIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.pg.text.lucene.LuceneIndex<T>
      • oracle.pg.text.lucene.LuceneAutoIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
        • oracle.pg.text.lucene.LuceneEdgeAutoIndex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Index<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>, OracleAutoIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>, OracleIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HBaseLuceneEdgeAutoIndex

    public abstract class LuceneEdgeAutoIndex
extends LuceneAutoIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
    This class extends the functions defined in LuceneAutoIndex to handle an automatic index on edges.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.CloseableIterable<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge> get(java.lang.Object query)
        Gets an Iterable object with all the matching elements that match the given query object. This object can be either a String text search query, or a Lucene Query object, or a TopDocs object.
        Specified by:
        get in interface OracleIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
        Specified by:
        get in class LuceneIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
        Parameters:
        query - a object representing the text query to execute.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.

      • get

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.CloseableIterable<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge> get(java.lang.String key,
                                                                                     java.lang.Object value,
                                                                                     java.lang.Class dtClass,
                                                                                     boolean acceptWildcard)
        Gets all edges indexed by the provided key/value.
        Specified by:
        get in interface OracleIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
        Specified by:
        get in class LuceneIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property. It MUST not be NULL. If the key is not found in the index, the result will be 0.
        value - the value object of the property. It can be NULL which will cause all elements with the given key to be returned.
        dtClass - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtClass is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        Returns:
        an iterable of edges that have a particular key/value in the index.

      • getDocIdentifier

        public final java.lang.String getDocIdentifier()
        Gets the document's identifier associated to this index.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Returns:
        the document's identifier associated to this index.

      • getPartitioned

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.CloseableIterable<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>[] getPartitioned(java.lang.Object[] connections,
                                                                                                  java.lang.Object query,
                                                                                                  int startShardId)
        Gets an array of CloseableIterable objects that hold all the edges with an attribute matching the Query object. This object can be either a String text search query, or a Lucene Query object. Each edge in the CloseableIterable array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from a corresponding Lucene sub-directory. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the sub-directories in a Lucene index with N shards. The subset of shards (subdirectories) queried will consist of those shards with ID value in the range of [startShardId, startShardId - 1 + size of connections array].
        Specified by:
        getPartitioned in interface OracleIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
        Specified by:
        getPartitioned in class LuceneIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
        Parameters:
        connections - an array of connections to the Lucene index Each edge of this array should be of type SearcherManager. See LuceneIndex.getOracleSearcherManager(int).
        query - a a object representing the text query to execute.
        startShardId - the ID of the starting shard.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.

      • getPartitioned

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.CloseableIterable<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>[] getPartitioned(java.lang.Object[] connections,
                                                                                                  java.lang.String key,
                                                                                                  java.lang.Object value,
                                                                                                  java.lang.Class dtClass,
                                                                                                  boolean acceptWildcard,
                                                                                                  int startShardId)
        Gets an array of CloseableIterable objects that hold all the edges with an attribute matching the given K/V pair. Each edge in the CloseableIterable array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from a corresponding Lucene sub-directory. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the sub-directories in a Lucene index with N shards. The subset of shards (subdirectories) queried will consist of those shards with ID value in the range of [startShardId, startShardId - 1 + size of connections array].
        Specified by:
        getPartitioned in interface OracleIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
        Specified by:
        getPartitioned in class LuceneIndex<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge>
        Parameters:
        connections - an array of connections to the Lucene index Each edge of this array should be of type SearcherManager. See LuceneIndex.getOracleSearcherManager(int).
        key - the name of the property. It MUST not be NULL. If the key is not found in the index, the result will be 0.
        value - the value object of the property. It can be NULL which will cause all elements with the given key to be returned.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        startShardId - the ID of the starting shard.
        dtClass - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtValue is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.
